column3: At one minute past six, he turned to Tom and said, “Hi, I’m Nat Cartwright and…”
“No one stops, even to draw breath, until one minute past six when the last vote will have been cast."

David had followed me at one minute past six. Then three others had managed to get away, making it five altogether. But as the sixth Hurricane was gathering speed for lift-off, a swarm of Messerschmitts had come swooping in over the olive trees.
